flashcards.back: Koyas of Godavari Agency, Andhra Pradesh. Leader: Alluri Sitarama Raju. Response to British imposition of forced labour, restrictions on gathering minor forest produce, prohibition of traditional agricultural practices. Legacy: His resistance continued until capture and execution in 1924, cementing his role as martyr in fight against British colonial rule

Nallamalai Forests, Andhra Pradesh. Leaders: Venkattappaya, K. Hanumanthu. Movement driven by tribal opposition to British control over forests. Venkattappaya and K. Hanumanthu connected with Gandhi's Non-Cooperation Movement, leading to forest satyagraha. Chenchus engaged in non-violent resistance, allowing their cattle to graze freely in forest in defiance of British fees. Movement spread to Palnad, where people declared Swaraj and confronted police. This was part of larger tribal response to British impositions during 1920s, aligning with broader nationalist movements. Movement showcased tribal resistance and their role in Indian independence struggle

Zeliangrong Territory, Manipur. Leader: Rani Gaidinliu. Heraka movement, led by Haipou Jadonang, was socio-religious movement advocating for Naga self-(Naga Raj) and resistance against British missionaries and their efforts to convert tribes to Christianity. Rani Gaidinliu, after embracing Gandhian principles, initiated open rebellion against British rule at age 17. Naga tribes refused to pay taxes and cooperate with British. Movement had reformist religious objectives but also strong political undertones challenging British rule. British authorities, fearful of movement's growing influence, arrested and executed Jadonang in 1931. Gaidinliu captured in 1932 and sentenced to life imprisonment. Despite repression, movement had lasting cultural and political impacts on Naga resistance

Leader: Unspecified. Gond Uprising focused on uniting followers of Gond Dharmma against British rule. Movement emphasised tribal unity and religious identity as tools to oppose British oppression. Uprising was part of broader tribal resistance in central India against colonial authority
